original_data.Title: Google Cloud Digital Leader Training
original_data.Short Intro: Gain foundational cloud and digital transformation literacy.
original_data.Prequisites:
No prior experience required.
See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Introduction to Digital Transformation with Google CloudDefine foundational terms such as cloud, data, and digital transformationExplore examples of companies around the world that are using cloud technology to revolutionize their businessesOverview of the types of opportunities and challenges that companies often encounter in their digital transformation journeyDefine foundational terms such as cloud, data, and digital transformationExplore examples of companies around the world that are using cloud technology to revolutionize their businessesOverview of the types of opportunities and challenges that companies often encounter in their digital transformation journeyInnovating with Data and Google CloudLearn what data is, historical ways companies have used it to make decisions, and why it is so critical for machine learningIntroduces technical concepts such as structured and unstructured data, database, data warehouse, and data lakesCover the most common and fastest growing Google Cloud products around dataLearn what data is, historical ways companies have used it to make decisions, and why it is so critical for machine learningIntroduces technical concepts such as structured and unstructured data, database, data warehouse, and data lakesCover the most common and fastest growing Google Cloud products around dataInfrastructure and Application ModernizationExplore the challenges of an outdated IT infrastructure and how businesses can modernize it using cloud technologyExplore the different compute options available in the cloud and the benefits of eachConsider a range of Google Cloud solutions that can help businesses to better develop and manage their systemsExplore the challenges of an outdated IT infrastructure and how businesses can modernize it using cloud technologyExplore the different compute options available in the cloud and the benefits of eachConsider a range of Google Cloud solutions that can help businesses to better develop and manage their systemsUnderstanding Google Cloud Security and OperationsExplore how businesses can choose to maintain some or none of their own infrastructure by purchasing IT services from a cloud providerExplain how the responsibility of data security is shared between the cloud provider and the businessExplore the defense-in-depth security built into Google between the cloud provider and the businessExplore the defense-in-depth security built into Google Cloud

unified_data.title: Google Cloud Digital Leader Training
unified_data.description: Gain foundational cloud and digital transformation literacy.
learning_outcomes: Identify common opportunities and challenges in digital transformation journeys.
Describe key technical concepts related to data storage and processing.
Overview Google Cloud Platform (GCP) most common services.
Explore real-world examples of companies leveraging cloud technology.
Define foundational terms related to cloud computing and digital transformation.
Understand the role of data in decision-making and machine learning.

original_data.Title: Cloud Native Fundamentals
original_data.Short Intro: Learn how to structure, package, and release an application to a Kubernetes cluster, while using an automated CI/CD pipeline.
original_data.Prequisites:
A well-prepared learner will meet the following prerequisites:

Understand the basics of http (like client, server, and internet request)
Basic Python (data types, Functions, REST requests, web development)
Ability to use Git, Linux machines, and Linux Command Line
Familiar with Web application development in any language
Familiarity with Docker and exposure to a CI/CD pipeline are not required for success in this program but are helpful skills to have.

See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

unified_data.title: Cloud Native Fundamentals
unified_data.description: Learn how to structure, package, and release an application to a Kubernetes cluster, while using an automated CICD pipeline.
learning_outcomes: Deploy applications to Kubernetes using declarative and imperative techniques.
Bootstrap a Kubernetes cluster using k3s.
Automate application deployment using a CI/CD pipeline.
Choose appropriate monolith or microservice architecture for an application.
Evaluate the cloud native ecosystem and CNCF tooling.
Package and distribute applications using Docker and DockerHub.

original_data.Title: Firebase in a Weekend: Android
original_data.Short Intro: Building a Realtime Chat App
original_data.Prequisites: You need to have proficiency in Java and the Android Framework (Android Basics or equivalent level). Familiarity with Git, using open web APIs and feeling comfortable with Android Studio will also be helpful.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: SaturdayWhy Choose FirebaseCreating a Firebase ProjectReading and Writing using Firebase Realtime Database and AuthenticationWhy Choose FirebaseCreating a Firebase ProjectReading and Writing using Firebase Realtime Database and AuthenticationSundayStoring DataLeveraging Analytics to Improve User EngagementNotifications, Remote ConfigStoring DataLeveraging Analytics to Improve User EngagementNotifications, Remote ConfigMondayIntroduction to Cloud Functions for FirebaseDeploy Cloud Functions using the Firebase CLIExtend mobile app functionality with server-side codeIntroduction to Cloud Functions for FirebaseDeploy Cloud Functions using the Firebase CLIExtend mobile app functionality with server-side code

unified_data.title: Firebase in a Weekend: Android
unified_data.description: Building a Realtime Chat App
learning_outcomes: Create a Firebase project and integrate it with an Android application
Extend Android app functionality using Firebase Cloud Functions
Leverage Firebase Analytics to track user engagement in an Android app
Implement user authentication using Firebase Authentication
Store and retrieve data using Firebase Realtime Database
Deploy Firebase Cloud Functions using the Firebase CLI

original_data.Title: Server-Side Swift
original_data.Short Intro: Production-Ready Swift in the Cloud
original_data.Prequisites: Students should have experience making network requests in Swift prior to taking this course. Experience using the command line, whether on a macOS or Linux system, is helpful, but not required.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Running Swift Locally and on the ServerConfiguring Swift on macOS and LinuxUsing the Swift Package ManagerBuild simple Swift serversConfiguring Swift on macOS and LinuxUsing the Swift Package ManagerBuild simple Swift serversA Microservices MindsetRun a monolithic Swift serviceSplit a monolith into microservicesPlan a new iOS app using a microservice-based backendRun a monolithic Swift serviceSplit a monolith into microservicesPlan a new iOS app using a microservice-based backendBuilding a Swift MicroserviceCreate a CRUD-based microservice in SwiftInteract with a MySQL database from SwiftAdd paging and transaction support to a serviceCreate a CRUD-based microservice in SwiftInteract with a MySQL database from SwiftAdd paging and transaction support to a serviceCreate an Authentication MicroserviceCreate a microservice using Facebook's AccountKitGenerate JSON web tokens (JWTs) for use across servicesBuild custom middleware to validate JWTsCreate a microservice using Facebook's AccountKitGenerate JSON web tokens (JWTs) for use across servicesBuild custom middleware to validate JWTs

unified_data.title: Server-Side Swift
unified_data.description: Production-Ready Swift in the Cloud
learning_outcomes: Configure Swift development environments on macOS and Linux for server-side development.
Apply a microservices mindset to software development projects.
Integrate Swift microservices with MySQL databases.
Build and deploy simple Swift servers using the Swift Package Manager.
Design and implement microservices using Swift.
Implement authentication and authorization using JSON Web Tokens (JWT).

original_data.Short Intro: Develop Feature-Rich Android Apps with the Kotlin Programming Language.
original_data.Prequisites: General Experience: Comfortable with Object Oriented Programming and Android fundamentals with Kotlin.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

unified_data.title: Advanced Android with Kotlin
unified_data.description: Develop Feature-Rich Android Apps with the Kotlin Programming Language.
learning_outcomes: Implement custom notifications with actions and styling in Android applications.
Implement custom graphics and clipping techniques in Android apps.
Integrate Firebase Cloud Messaging to send push notifications.
Utilize MotionLayout to create complex and coordinated animations.
Develop custom Android views for unique user interfaces.
Apply animations to enhance user experience using property animations.

original_data.Title: Firebase in a Weekend: iOS
original_data.Short Intro: Building a Realtime Chat App
original_data.Prequisites: You need to have proficiency in building an iOS mobile application, including experience in basic command line, calling a web or cloud API, working with the view controller life cycle, using multiple view controllers, and working with UITableViewController (iOS Developer Nanodegree or equivalent level). Familiarity working with a web service from iOS, using Core Data, or building apps that use databases will also be helpful.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

unified_data.title: Firebase in a Weekend: iOS
unified_data.description: Building a Realtime Chat App
learning_outcomes: Utilize Firebase Analytics to track user engagement and app performance
Deploy and manage Firebase Cloud Functions to extend iOS app functionality with server-side code
Implement real-time data reading and writing using Firebase Realtime Database in an iOS application
Create a Firebase project and configure it for iOS development
Implement Firebase Remote Config to dynamically update app behavior
Integrate Firebase Authentication to manage user accounts in an iOS app

original_data.Title: Network Security
original_data.Short Intro: Offered at Georgia Tech as CS 6262
original_data.Prequisites: To succeed in this course, you should have:Intermediate to advanced programming knowledgeKnowledge of basic computer networking principlesKnowledge of basic information security principlesSee the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.
original_data.What you learn: Large-Scale AttacksDDoS AttacksMalware-Based Attacks, Phishing, &  FraudUnderground infrastructuresDDoS AttacksMalware-Based Attacks, Phishing, &  FraudUnderground infrastructuresTesting and Security AssessmentsPenetration TestingSocial Engineering and Human FactorsWeb Security Models & Security and Internet ProtocolsPenetration TestingSocial Engineering and Human FactorsWeb Security Models & Security and Internet ProtocolsAdvanced TopicsEvasive and Mobile MalwareBotnet detection & Cloud SecurityAttack-Tolerant SystemsEvasive and Mobile MalwareBotnet detection & Cloud SecurityAttack-Tolerant Systems

unified_data.title: Network Security
unified_data.description: Offered at Georgia Tech as CS 6262
learning_outcomes: Apply penetration testing techniques to identify vulnerabilities in systems.
Evaluate underground infrastructures used for malicious activities.
Evaluate advanced topics in network security, including evasive malware and botnet detection.
Analyze web security models and internet protocols to mitigate threats.
Understand social engineering tactics and human factors in security breaches.
Analyze large-scale network attacks, including DDoS and malware-based attacks.

unified_data.title: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Architect Associate
unified_data.description: Uplevel with in-demand OCI skills that can help you advance your career.
learning_outcomes: Understand the core architectural principles of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)
Configure and manage Identity and Access Management (IAM) within OCI
Manage OCI resources effectively using compartments and policies
Implement network security using security lists and Network Security Groups (NSGs)
Establish connectivity options for OCI resources and on-premises infrastructure
Design and implement Virtual Cloud Networks (VCNs) for secure cloud deployments

original_data.Title: Real-Time Analytics with Apache Storm
original_data.Short Intro: The "Hadoop of Real-Time"
original_data.Prequisites: Programming language required: JavaTo be successful, you'll need intermediate knowledge of Java. Specifically, this is defined by experience and comfort with Java syntax, compile & run-time error diagnostics and debugging, ability to use javadocs as needed, and intermediate data structures including Arrays, HashMaps, and LinkedLists.  If you need to build these skills, a good starting point is Udacitys Introduction to Java with additional comfortability needed identifying and debugging compile & run-time errors.No prior experience is assumed in Ubuntu, git, Maven, Redis, Flask (Python) or d3 (Javascript).  Python is useful, but optional.  A basic course such as CS101 or OO in Python would be helpful.See the Technology Requirements for using Udacity.

unified_data.title: Real-Time Analytics with Apache Storm
unified_data.description: The Hadoop of Real-Time
learning_outcomes: Design and implement basic Storm topologies for real-time data processing
Apply Java programming skills to develop Storm bolts and spouts
Integrate open-source components with Storm for advanced analytics
Connect to real-time data sources like the Twitter API using Storm
Utilize stream grouping techniques to process multiple data streams in Storm
Understand the architecture and components of Apache Storm

original_data.Title: How to Become a Data Scientist
original_data.Short Intro: Gain real-world data science experience with projects designed by industry experts. Build your portfolio and advance your data science career.
original_data.Prequisites: We recommend students are familiar with machine learning concepts, like those in the Intro to Machine Learning Nanodegree Program. In addition, students should be familiar with Python programming, probability, and statistics.
original_data.What you learn:
Youll master the skills necessary to become a successful Data Scientist. Youll work on projects designed by industry experts, and learn to run data pipelines, design experiments, build recommendation systems, and deploy solutions to the cloud.

 If you already have experience with machine learning, take this program.

unified_data.title: How to Become a Data Scientist
unified_data.description: Gain real-world data science experience with projects designed by industry experts. Build your portfolio and advance your data science career.
learning_outcomes: Deploy machine learning solutions to cloud platforms like AWS or Azure.
Design and implement end-to-end data pipelines for real-world applications.
Apply statistical analysis techniques to interpret data and draw meaningful conclusions.
Build and deploy recommendation systems using machine learning techniques.
Develop and manage data science projects from conception to deployment.
Apply experimental design principles to evaluate and optimize data-driven solutions.

original_data.Title: Full Stack Web Developer
original_data.Short Intro: Learn to design and develop powerful modern web applications that form the foundation for the apps, websites, and systems that people and businesses use every day.
original_data.Prequisites: To optimize your chances of success in the Full Stack Web Developer Nanodegree program, we recommend that you have experience writing and testing software with Python or another object-oriented programming language.
original_data.What you learn: The goal of the Full Stack Web Developer Nanodegree program is to equip learners with the unique skills they need to build database-backed APIs and web applications. A graduate of this program will be able to design and build databases for software applications, create and deploy database-backed web APIs, and secure and manage user authentication and access control for an application backend. Students will also learn how to deploy a Flask-based web application to the cloud using Docker and Kubernetes.

unified_data.title: Full Stack Web Developer
unified_data.description: Learn to design and develop powerful modern web applications that form the foundation for the apps, websites, and systems that people and businesses use every day.
learning_outcomes: Manage database interactions using SQLAlchemy
Secure web applications against common vulnerabilities
Deploy web applications to the cloud using Docker and Kubernetes
Implement user authentication and access control mechanisms
Develop and deploy RESTful APIs using Flask
Design relational databases for web applications

original_data.Title: Cloud Native Application Architecture
original_data.Short Intro: Meet the growing demand for cloud native architects and learn to identify the best application architecture solutions for an organizations needs.
original_data.Prequisites: HTTP, Python, Git, Linux, Docker.
original_data.What you learn: Youll master the skills necessary to become a successful cloud native architect. Learn to run and manage scalable applications in a cloud native environment, using open source tools and projects like ArgoCD, gRPC, and Grafana.

unified_data.title: Cloud Native Application Architecture
unified_data.description: Meet the growing demand for cloud native architects and learn to identify the best application architecture solutions for an organizations needs.
learning_outcomes: Utilize open source tools like ArgoCD for continuous delivery
Implement gRPC for efficient microservice communication
Identify optimal application architecture solutions for cloud native environments
Monitor application performance using Grafana
Design and implement cloud-native application architectures
Run and manage scalable applications in the cloud

original_data.Title: Become a Cloud DevOps Engineer
original_data.Short Intro: Companies are looking for talented DevOps engineers to remain competitive in this agile world. Enroll now to operationalize infrastructure at scale and deliver applications and services at high velocity, an essential skill for advancing your career.
original_data.Prequisites: You should have intermediate knowledge of Javascript, and familiarity with object-oriented programming, web development with HTML and CSS, and the Linux Command Line.
original_data.What you learn: Learn to design and deploy infrastructure as code, build and monitor CI/CD pipelines for different deployment strategies, and deploy scalable microservices using Kubernetes. At the end of the program, youll combine your new skills by completing a capstone project.

unified_data.title: Become a Cloud DevOps Engineer
unified_data.description: Companies are looking for talented DevOps engineers to remain competitive in this agile world. Enroll now to operationalize infrastructure at scale and deliver applications and services at high velocity, an essential skill for advancing your career.

original_data.Title: Become a Data Architect
original_data.Short Intro: Learn how to plan, design and implement enterprise data infrastructure solutions and create the blueprints for your organizations data success.
original_data.Prequisites: Intermediate Python and SQL skills, and basic familiarity with ETL/Data Pipelines.
original_data.What you learn: In this program, youll plan, design and implement enterprise data infrastructure solutions and create the blueprints for an organizations data management system. Youll create a relational database with PostGreSQL, design an Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) data model to build a cloud based data warehouse, and design scalable data lake architecture that meets the needs of Big Data. Finally, youll learn how to apply the principles of data governance to an organizations data management system.

unified_data.title: Become a Data Architect
unified_data.description: Learn how to plan, design and implement enterprise data infrastructure solutions and create the blueprints for your organizations data success.

original_data.Title: Data Engineering with Microsoft Azure
original_data.Short Intro: Master the job-ready skills you need to succeed as a Microsoft Azure data engineer like designing data models and utilizing other in-demand components of the cloud computing service.
original_data.Prequisites: Experience with SQL, Python, Azure, and Github.
original_data.What you learn: Learners will acquire the skills needed to design data models, create data pipelines, and navigate large datasets on the Azure platform. Additionally, they will learn to build data warehouses, data lakes, and lakehouse architecture.

unified_data.title: Data Engineering with Microsoft Azure
unified_data.description: Master the job-ready skills you need to succeed as a Microsoft Azure data engineer like designing data models and utilizing other in-demand components of the cloud computing service.

original_data.Title: Become an AWS Cloud Architect
original_data.Short Intro: Lead your organization's cloud computing strategy as an AWS Cloud Architect. Plan, design, and build secure, high availability cloud infrastructure.
original_data.Prequisites: Experience with Cloud Computing, Programming, and AWS.
original_data.What you learn: Play a critical role in an organizations cloud computing strategy as an AWS Cloud Architect. Learn to plan, design, and implement secure cloud infrastructure in AWS at scale. Begin by designing and building high availability infrastructure, and then move on to building scalable, secure, and cost-optimized architecture. Finally, explore and execute best practices and strategies around securing access to cloud services and infrastructure.

unified_data.title: Become an AWS Cloud Architect
unified_data.description: Lead your organizations cloud computing strategy as an AWS Cloud Architect. Plan, design, and build secure, high availability cloud infrastructure.

original_data.Title: Become a Cloud Developer
original_data.Short Intro: Cloud development is the foundation for the new world of software development. Enroll now to build and deploy production-ready full stack apps at scale on AWS, an essential skill for advancing your web development career.
original_data.Prequisites: You should have intermediate knowledge of Javascript, and familiarity with object-oriented programming, web development with HTML and CSS, and the Linux Command Line.
original_data.What you learn: Start by learning the fundamentals of cloud development and deployment with AWS. Then, build different apps leveraging microservices, Kubernetes clusters, and serverless application technology.

unified_data.title: Become a Cloud Developer
unified_data.description: Cloud development is the foundation for the new world of software development. Enroll now to build and deploy production-ready full stack apps at scale on AWS, an essential skill for advancing your web development career.

original_data.Title: Become a Cloud Developer using Microsoft Azure
original_data.Short Intro: Learn to build cloud-based applications on Microsoft Azure, the cloud services platform used by 95% of Fortune 500 companies.
original_data.Prequisites: Intermediate programming experience, familiarity with SQL databases and version control with Git.
original_data.What you learn: Microsoft Azure is one of the most popular cloud services platforms used by enterprises, making it a crucial tool for cloud computing professionals to add to their skillset. The Cloud Developer using Microsoft Azure Nanodegree program teaches students how to deploy, build, migrate, and monitor applications on Azure, thereby preparing learners for success on Microsofts AZ-204 Azure Developer Associate Expert certification.

unified_data.title: Become a Cloud Developer using Microsoft Azure
unified_data.description: Learn to build cloud-based applications on Microsoft Azure, the cloud services platform used by 95 of Fortune 500 companies.

original_data.Title: Golang
original_data.Short Intro: Learn Go language fundamentals needed for careers involving cloud services, web applications, DevOps tools, and backend development.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic computer programming.
original_data.What you learn: This Go programming language online course provides learners with the job-ready digital skills they need to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

unified_data.title: Golang
unified_data.description: Learn Go language fundamentals needed for careers involving cloud services, web applications, DevOps tools, and backend development.

original_data.Title: Cloud DevOps using Microsoft Azure
original_data.Short Intro: Learn to develop and deploy cloud-based applications on Microsoft Azure, the cloud services platform used by 95% of Fortune 500 companies.
original_data.Prequisites: Intermediate Python, familiarity with Linux shell scripting and cloud concepts.
original_data.What you learn: Microsoft Azure is one of the most popular cloud services platforms used by enterprises, making it a crucial tool for cloud computing professionals to add to their skillset. The Cloud DevOps using Microsoft Azure Nanodegree program teaches students how to deploy, test, and monitor cloud applications on Azure, thereby preparing learners for success on Microsofts AZ-400 DevOps Engineer Expert certification exam.

unified_data.title: Cloud DevOps using Microsoft Azure
unified_data.description: Learn to develop and deploy cloud-based applications on Microsoft Azure, the cloud services platform used by 95 of Fortune 500 companies.

original_data.Title: Cloud Architect using Microsoft Azure
original_data.Short Intro: Meet the growing demand for Azure cloud architects and learn the skills to translate business requirements into technical specifications for reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure using Microsoft Azure.
original_data.Prequisites: Experience with cloud computing, programming and Microsoft Azure.
original_data.What you learn: This program prepares students for a career as an Azure Solution Architect and trains them to translate business requirements into technical specifications for reliable, scalable and secure cloud infrastructure using Microsoft Azure.

unified_data.title: Cloud Architect using Microsoft Azure
unified_data.description: Meet the growing demand for Azure cloud architects and learn the skills to translate business requirements into technical specifications for reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure using Microsoft Azure.

original_data.Title: Cloud Computing for Business Leaders
original_data.Short Intro: Gain the technical understanding to make tough, IT-driven decisions that unlock the value of cloud computing in your organization.
original_data.Prequisites: Word Processors, Spreadsheets, Presentation Tools.
original_data.What you learn: This program will focus on the unique knowledge and skills that business leaders need to unlock the value of cloud technologies in their organizations, or enable a more cloud-native department that leverages cloud computing to drive growth and create operational efficiencies.

unified_data.title: Cloud Computing for Business Leaders
unified_data.description: Gain the technical understanding to make tough, IT-driven decisions that unlock the value of cloud computing in your organization.

original_data.Title: Learn multi-cloud computing.
original_data.Short Intro: Start applying multi-cloud architecture principles to keep IT infrastructure running smoothly and help mitigate challenges that you face in your day-to-day.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic knowledge of Git, cloud providers & Terraform.
original_data.What you learn: This multiple cloud computing course was designed to introduce learners to multi-cloud architectures and how to design and implement these architectures effectively. It provides learners with the job-ready digital skills they need to approach the shift to a multi-cloud strategy. This involves adopting a mixture of Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) services from 2 or more cloud providers and sharing workloads between eachallowing users to choose services that meet their specific needs.

unified_data.title: Learn multi-cloud computing.
unified_data.description: Start applying multi-cloud architecture principles to keep IT infrastructure running smoothly and help mitigate challenges that you face in your day-to-day.
